tutorial.speak:
The Manage Appearance section allows you to configure global appearance options such as logo, colors, and fonts.
You will see a preview of a website with your current styles. Click any option on the right to get started. We'll start with Color Palette.
This is where you set the overall color theme for your site.
Click on any of the suggested pallets to choose a different scheme. The pairings show suggestions of how these colors can be used together.
You can also set your own custom theme by double clicking on any of the five colors to manually set the color.
Slide the dial, use the dropper, set the RGB,
Or use the toggle to set the value as hex.
Click Save and the preview will be updated with your choices. Next we'll choose fonts.
You can set global fonts for the headings and for the body text of your pages. If you choose, you can still use additional fonts on specific elements.
Simply click on either font and you'll be able to choose from thousands of options provided by Google Fonts.
Search for a specific name or use the category filter to browse.
Choose a font and you can see how your pairing will look.
Click save and the preview site has also been updated.
The CSS and Javascript section is an advanced option for those familiar with web development. Add any code you wish to be included on your pages such as tracking scripts.
Finally the logo section allows you to brand your website and other features with your logo. Click the pencil icon to edit.
You'll need to provide two versions of your logo. One for dark backgrounds and another for light backgrounds. Simply click either to edit.
You'll see an Upload button for providing the image. Be sure it is on a transparent background.
The site expects a 4 by 1 logo, so you will be given a cropping tool to ensure your logo is the appropriate shape by adding the necessary horizontal and vertical padding. Adjust accordingly and click Update and Save.
